div.p: No.2113, pp. 496-7, unit 77, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.

Melbourne 10 June 1887.
Document is a circular (p. 497) individually addressed to the heads of 15 departments within the Chief Secretary's Department (listed p. 496).

With reference to the advances which have been made to enable payments to be made to probationers of the second moiety of their salaries, I am to inform you that inasmuch as according to the 78th section of the Public Service Act such second moiety is only payable upon permanent appointment, the amount cannot be charged to the Vote of 1886-7 unless the permanent appointment be made on or before the 30th instant, therefore the advances must remain unadjusted for the present and provision for the amount of such half salaries up to the 30th instant must be made upon the Estimates of 1887-8 as an arrear.
